alert.note: Alert for Gwinnett; Walton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 09 at 11:15AM EST until January 10 at 12:55AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Alcovy River at New Hope Road near Grayson affecting Walton and Gwinnett Counties. For the Alcovy River Basin...including Grayson...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Alcovy River at New Hope Road near Grayson. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Moderate flooding begins. Significant flooding expands further into the woodlands upstream and downstream from the river gauge at New Hope Road. The water level reaches the bottom of the bridge. County officials may need to close the bridge due to erosion to the banks on the sides of the bridge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EST Tuesday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage this evening to 6.2 feet and continue to fall. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 08/31/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1115 PM EST.
